AgentSpec.description:
Canonical, strongly-typed Agent specification used across the system.

This represents a declarative way to define an Agent without constructing it yet.
AgentSpec is used to create an Agent instance.
It can be defined as a config (loaded from a md, yaml, json, etc.), or
it can be created programmatically.

resource.description: Protected resource identifier to include in token/authorize requests (RFC 8707).

authorization_server.description: Authorization server base URL (provider metadata is discovered from this root).

client_secret.title: Client Secret
client_secret.description: OAuth client secret for confidential clients.

access_token.description: Optional pre-seeded access token that bypasses the interactive flow.

refresh_token.description: Optional refresh token stored alongside a pre-seeded access token.

expires_at.description: Epoch timestamp (seconds) when the pre-seeded token expires.

token_type.description: Token type returned by the provider; defaults to Bearer.

redirect_uri_options.description: Allowed redirect URI values; the flow selects from this list.

extra_authorize_params.title: Extra Authorize Params
extra_authorize_params.description: Additional query parameters to append to the authorize request.

extra_token_params.title: Extra Token Params
extra_token_params.description: Additional form parameters to append to the token request.

require_pkce.title: Require Pkce
require_pkce.description: Whether to enforce PKCE when initiating the authorization code flow.

use_internal_callback.title: Use Internal Callback
use_internal_callback.description: When true, attempt to use the app's internal callback URL before loopback.

include_resource_parameter.title: Include Resource Parameter
include_resource_parameter.description: Whether to include the RFC 8707 `resource` parameter in authorize/token requests.

WorkflowTaskRetryPolicy.description:
Declarative retry policy for workflow tasks / activities (mirrors Temporal RetryPolicy fields).
Durations can be specified either as seconds (number) or ISO8601 timedelta strings; both are
coerced to datetime.timedelta instances.
